data.title: The Cannes crowd loved this offbeat romantic tale
data.meta_description: If you’ve never seen anything by this idiosyncratic, Finnish auteur, this is a good place to start.
data.text:
John McDonald

Feb 15, 2024 – 11.09am

EmailLinkedInTwitterFacebook

Subscribe to gift this article

Gift 5 articles to anyone you choose each month when you subscribe.

Subscribe now

Already a subscriber?

You’ll have to wait until the credits roll to hear Fallen Leaves sung in Finnish, but like all Aki Kaurismäki films, there’s no shortage of music along the way. This bittersweet story about two ordinary people who find each other, in the most hesitant fashion, is one of Kaurismäki’s typical working-class fables.

If you’re already familiar with his movies, you’ll know what to expect. If you’ve never seen anything by the idiosyncratic, Finnish auteur, this is a good place to start.
